citations.narrative:
The records for the cats owned, held, acquired, or transferred by the licensee were not current. There were no records for
the 8 cats acquired since the last inspection and no disposition information for the 3 cats no longer on the premises since
the last inspection.
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and
disposition of cats in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers and the sources of the animals. The
Licensee needs to ensure that complete acquisition and disposition information is recorded for the 11 cats noted above as
well as for all future cat acquisitions and dispositions.

The records for animals owned, held, acquired, or transferred by the licensee were not current. There were no records for
the 6 animals acquired since the last inspection (goats #4; alpacas #2) and there was no disposition information for the 7
animals no longer on the premises since the last inspection (goats #3; alpacas #2; rabbits #2).
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and
disposition of animals in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers and the sources of the animals. The
Licensee needs to ensure that complete acquisition and disposition information is recorded for the 13 animals noted
above as well as for all future animal acquisitions and dispositions.

There was no Contingency Plan developed or documented by the Licensee at the time of the inspection. A written plan
should have been in place by 7/5/22.
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling,
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster (one which could
reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the animals in their
possession). The contingency plan requirement ensures that the animals receive proper care during emergency
situations. Correct by 7/24/23.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The records for the cats owned, held, acquired, or transferred by the licensee were not current. There were no records for 
the 8 cats acquired since the last inspection and no disposition information for the 3 cats no longer on the premises since 
the last inspection.  
 
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and 
disposition of cats in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers and the sources of the animals. The 
Licensee needs to ensure that complete acquisition and disposition information is recorded for the 11 cats noted above as 
well as for all future cat acquisitions and dispositions. 
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The records for animals owned, held, acquired, or transferred by the licensee were not current. There were no records for 
the 6 animals acquired since the last inspection (goats #4; alpacas #2) and there was no disposition information for the 7 
animals no longer on the premises since the last inspection (goats #3; alpacas #2; rabbits #2). 
 
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and 
disposition of animals in their possession in order to account for all animal transfers and the sources of the animals. The 
Licensee needs to ensure that complete acquisition and disposition information is recorded for the 13 animals noted 
above as well as for all future animal acquisitions and dispositions. 
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
There was no Contingency Plan developed or documented by the Licensee at the time of the inspection. A written plan 
should have been in place by 7/5/22. 
 
Per this Section, exhibitors must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, 
treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster (one which could

reasonably be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the animals in their 
possession). The contingency plan requirement ensures that the animals receive proper care during emergency 
situations. Correct by 7/24/23. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 *END OF REPORT* 
 
 n
